intro: Planchonella serpentinicola, commonly known as the serpentine pomegranate, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, orange-red fruits. The plant thrives in nutrient-poor, calcareous soils, particularly those containing serpentine rock. Its botanical features include a slender, branching stem and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The fruit, which is edible, contains several seeds enclosed in a fleshy, juicy pericarp.
